Key Match Events: Bam Adebayo had his first good game of 2025, finishing with 19 points, nine rebounds, and five assists on 64.3 percent shooting.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. finished with 18 points, five rebounds, and one assist on 58.3 percent shooting and 33.3 percent from three-point range.
Nikola Jovic finished with 20 points, six rebounds, and four assists on 47.1 percent shooting and 25 percent from three-point range.
Jovic’s two corner threes in the fourth quarter broke the game open as the Heat expanded their lead.

The Heat remain undefeated when Alec Burks is utilized as a major part of the rotation, finishing with 11 points, four rebounds, and zero assists on 50 percent shooting and 50 percent from three-point range.
Post-Match Reflections: Erik Spoelstra described the victory as a 'breakthrough' for the Miami Heat.
